characters: SHELLEY, OLIVER AND ALL THE RESIDENTS OF THE NURSING HOME
TYLER HANDS HER HIS PHONE NUMBER
SHE SMILES AND PUTS IT IN HER PURSE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The iconic Playboy Mansion in all its glory. Peacocks and flamingos wander amongst topiaries celebrating the female form. Two hummingbirds feed off the ‘nipples’ of a pair o topiary breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lagoon-like oasis where BEAUTIFUL BLONDES frolic and sp as admiring men watch. We follow a shirtless BUTLER carry a tray of cocktails. He passes ADAM LEVINE from Maroon 5 sits on the diving board playing an acoustic version of " LOVE", entertaining the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: ADAM LEVINE
dialogues.text: (singing) "I have no choice, ‘cause I won't say goodbye any more --" A nearby girl wearing an oversize T-shirt hears the song. She drifts toward the music as if in a trance, stripping her shirt to reveal her tiny bikini. SCOTT CAAN does a running cannon-ball into the pool, splashing the girls.

dialogues.speaker: GIRLS
dialogues.text: (whiny) Scott! You're getting us wet!

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CAAN
dialogues.text: Hey Dad, did you see how big that splash was? JAMES CAAN is lounging by the pool surrounded by young gi

dialogues.speaker: JAMES CAAN
dialogues.text: Yeah Scott, that’s just great. (back to girls) Anyway, then Francis Ford Coppola says ‘Jimmy, you should direct The Godfather. After all, you wrote it.’ And I said, ‘No Francis, why don’t you do it.’ It felt good to give the kid a break. The girls all react, impressed. Then we see HUGH HEFNER being interviewed.

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER
dialogues.text: So Hef, as far as women go, do you have a ‘type’?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A type? No, I wouldn’t say I have a ‘type’. Widen to REVEAL Hef is surrounded by his three NEARLY IDENTICAL BUXOM BLONDES.

dialogues.speaker: HEF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As long as a woman is beautiful on the inside, that’s what counts. (noticing) Speaking of... We see SHELLEY DARLINGTON, 29, blonde, beautiful, tan, adorably wide-eyed. Sweet and bubbly, she radiates optimi and good cheer.

dialogues.speaker: HEF, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s my Shelley.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Hi, Hef!

dialogues.speaker: HEF
dialogues.text: (to interviewer ) Shelley Darlington, she’s lived here at the mansion for almost ten years. She’s one of my favorites. Shelley smiles, but at one end of the line of Hef’s girls bunny glares at Shelley, obviously jealous of her relationship with Hef. This is CASSANDRA, 20’s, a hot Bun with an ego as big as her boobs.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: You're so sweet to me Hef, but all the girls here are great.

dialogues.speaker: HEF
dialogues.text: And you're like their Mama Bear, taking care of them all. Hef's girls all smile, Cassandra just rolls her eyes in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley is treading water when suddenly Scott Caan swims

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CAAN
dialogues.text: When are you gonna let me steal you away from this place, Shelley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. Why would anyone ever leave the mansion?

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CAAN
dialogues.text: Good point. Hey Levine, how about a chicken fight!

dialogues.speaker: ADAM LEVINE
dialogues.text: You just signed your death warrant, Caan. Adam Levine ditches his guitar and dives in. Scott Caan dives under and surfaces under Shelley and lifts her up o his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, my gosh! I love riding bareback. Adam Levine comes up under..

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: (to Shelley; a little too intense) You're goin' down...

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CAAN
dialogues.text: Take her, Shelley.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to chicken fight, I’m a vegetarian...

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CAAN
dialogues.text: It’s not fighting, it’s just fun. Cassandra grabs Shelley’s head roughly and shoves her bac Shelley topples with a splash. She bobs back up, drenched disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Did we win? EXT. MANSION - POOL —- MOMENTS LATER 4 CLOSE ON a frozen cocktail being poured into a glass. We BACK to see Shelley, now dry, surrounded by adoring MEN a MARVIN, the handsome shirtless butler from before, refill their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Marvin. You make the best margaritas.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: That’s cuz these are mangoritas. I invented them myself.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Wow, they taste so much better when you spell it that way. Aren’t these the best Mangoritas guys? The men -- aging lotharios -- grunt in agreement. The COW stares at her boobs.

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: Not as good as the scenery, but I'll drink ‘em. Shelley looks behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, you like the waterfall?

dialogues.speaker: COWBOY
dialogues.text: No, darlin', I was talking about your te-taas.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (deeply touched) They’re two years old on Friday. Cassandra comes walking over.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: Shelley why are you keeping all the rich good looking guys to yourself? I think you should introduce me.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Of course. This is Cassandra she’s only been here a few months, but everybody loves her because she is super beautiful and she never throws up on anyone when she’s drunk. The men all nod in admiration. Cassandra looks disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: POTBELLY
dialogues.text: So, tell us, Shelley, how does a girl become a Bunny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, when I was a senior in high school, my guidance counselor said he knew the perfect job for me. So he took a picture of me in my bikini and sent it to the magazine. The next thing I knew, I was in LA shaking hands with Hugh Hefner! And he told me I didn't have to live in a foster home anymore. I could live here and have a whole new family! So, here I am.

dialogues.speaker: COMBOVER
dialogues.text: Are you a centerfold?

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: (catty) She wishes.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do so cross your fingers, hopefully Hef might give me good news at my birthday party this weekend... (sotto; excited) I have my turn-ons ready and everything.

dialogues.speaker: POTBELLY
dialogues.text: And what might those be...?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Tanning, giving backrubs, convertibles, and rude people. (beat, then) No, wait, rude people is a turn- off. I’m such a yummy dummy.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: True that.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Being a centerfold is the highest, most prestigious honor there is. It says “I’m naked in the middle of the magazine; unfold me.”

dialogues.speaker: POTBELLY
dialogues.text: I suppose it's kinda like the Nobel “piece of ass” Prize. They laugh hysterically. Shelley looks confused. Potbell puts his arm around her and gives her a squeeze. POTBELLY (CONT’D) (continuing) Well, darlin', seems like you've got a pretty good life here. Shelley beams, dreamily.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: It's paradise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREDITS ROLL and "BIG PIMPIN'" by Jay Z PLAYS, as a limo pulls up, disgorging a bevy of Bunnies, Shelley happily leading the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track down a row of salon chairs filled with Bunnies b beautified. Hair is bleached and blown. Extensions are attached. Make-up is applied. Unwanted hairs are waxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley leads the girls in Yoga on the lawn. She moves in the downward dog position, all the girls follow. A bunch gardeners stop what they’re doing to jostle for position behind the girls to stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the girls exit the with big clean smiles. They excitedly check out each others teeth and look at their o in little compact mirrors. They all hi-five each other

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are feeding the animals in their bikinis. One o the monkeys rips a girls bikini top off. The topless girl covers her boobs so the monkey can’t see them and everyon laughs. A girl monkey comes out and smacks the rapist mon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bunnies pull skimpy clothes off the rack as they're attended to by eager Saleswomen. Shelley steps out of the dressing room in an adorably slutty cocktail dress, twirl with delight.

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: I love that dress. Too bad it's the last one.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: It is? Then you should take it. The salesgirl pulls a red version of the dress off of the rack.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Here it is in red.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Yay! We can be different color twins!

dialogues.speaker: CASSANDRA
dialogues.text: (not excited) Great. They all walk over to the counter with arms full of cloth

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: We'll put this on the Mansion tab and have it all sent over this afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Aren't we the luckiest girls in the world?

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: Yes. You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley’s massive birthday party is in full swing. Everyo is dressed as pirates. Marvin the butler wheels in a huge cake that says ‘Happy Birthday Shelley’. Shelley makes a silent wish, then she blows the candles out and everyone nuts.  12 13 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bunnies are on the dance floor and shake their money- makers amidst a crowd of admirers. A waitress arrives wit tray of kamikaze shots. The Bunnies clink, drink and cont dancing. Shelley, in the center of it all, is having the of her life, as we DISSOLVE TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new day at the Mansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Decorated with PHOTOS from nine years of Mansion festivit Her BUNNY EARS are on a special shelf, lit like an Oscar. Shelley sleeps, hugging POOTER, her cranky white Himalaya cat. Marvin (shirtless) enters with a breakfast tray.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Your blueberry French Toast is ready, Shelley. He sets them gently on the foot of the bed as she awakens with a happy smile.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Ooh, laa laa... thank you, Marvin. Was that the best party last night or what?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: The best. Shelley sees an envelope on her breakfast tray.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: It’s from Mr. Hefner.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (excited) It is? It must be my birthday present! Is it finally happening? Am I Miss November? That’s what I wished for when I blew out my candles... (with sudden dread) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my G-d! I told you my wish. Now it’s not going to come true! (to envelope) I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to tell!

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Just open the envelope. She places the envelope over her heart and shuts her eyes

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) Okay, I'm ready. She opens it and reads aloud. SHELLEY (CONT’D) (continuing) "Dear, Shelley --" Oh, my G-d, that's me! "Please move out of the mansion immediately." She frowns, growing concerned, but keeps reading. SHELLEY (CONT’D) (continuing) "You have two hours to collect your belongings and leave the premises." (to Marvin) Hef's kicking me out? Why would he do that? This is my home! This is my family! Her big blue eyes fill with tears. Marvin feels bad.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I hate to have to tell you this, but maybe it’s because of your age.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: But I'm 27!

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: (shrugging) That's fifty-nine in Bunny years. Shelley frowns, trying to do the math.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Maybe if I just talk to Hef, he'll let me stay.  15 16 10.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Mr. Hefner left for Las Vegas this morning. I don’t think he’s that great with good-byes. Shelley starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How bout I make you one last mangorita for old times sake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley sobs and sips her last mangorita as she packs. PO watches disgruntled from his perch.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Pooter. We'll find a new place to live. It won't have coconut pancakes or poledancing lessons or fireworks on Pamela Lee’s birthday ... but we'll survive. Somehow. Pooter highly doubts this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley stands in the driveway with Pooter staring at a r Honda Accord. Marvin carries out her bags.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Where's my pink Prius?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: That car belongs to the company. This is the car you came here with. He puts her suitcase in the back. She sighs and gets in, starting it. She sees Pooter sitting on the driveway,

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: C'mon, Pooter. We have to find a new place to live. Pooter doesn’t budge.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Here let me help.  17 11. Marvin picks up Pooter but as he gets closer to the car Pooter starts freaking out. The harder he tries to put he the car the more she digs her claws into his bare chest. Finally he gives up and stands there with the cat clingin his chest.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s seems a little nervous. Why don’t I keep her here for a few days till she calms down.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Okay. Don’t worry Pooter I’1l get us a nice place to live. We pull out from the Oklahoma license plate to see the Ac putting out of the Mansion driveway, backfiring. Through back window, we see Pooter running back inside as quickly possible. Marvin stands in the driveway waving good bye w giant scratches all over his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley cries as she shops -- retail therapy. Shelley hol up a dress.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Will this make me look younger?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Absolutely. The salesperson takes the dress to the counter and rings up. YOUNG SALESWOMAN (CONT’D) Will that be cash or charge?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (confused) Oh, just put it on my tab.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: The mansion called this morning and you don’t have a tab anymore. Shelley looks shocked as the woman takes the dress away. Shelley makes a helpless little whimpering noise.
18 Shelley walks up to the reception desk, still tear-staine

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Jean-Michelle, can you please tell Svetlana I need to be exfoliated immediately? (leans in and whispers) I'm an old hag.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN-MICHELLE
dialogues.text: I am so sorry, Shelley. But the Mansion called and you are no longer a Bunny and therefore -- no longer can we fix your face. Shelley's makes a louder whimpering noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 Shelley hands her ticket to the valet, JORGE. He holds ou his hand.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: (continuing) That will be $7.50.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: For parking.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: But parking is free.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: Not if you are no longer Bunny. Shelley is crestfallen. Her world has spun off its starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: But -- What am I supposed to do? axis. She  13.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: (re the money) Look, I can’t stand to see a woman cry, so how about this -- flash me your boobs and you don’t have to pay.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Jorge!

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: Okay, just one boob. (off her look) Hey,it was worth a shot. You know what you need to do?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: Get a job. Shelley looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (continuing) What are your skills? Other than being pretty. She thinks.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I can twirl a baton... I can play roller-blade volleyball... I can spell almost every word I know, except for mononucleosis-- Jorge frowns, interrupting her.

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: Do you know how to carry a tray?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, my G-d! Yes! Is that a job?

dialogues.speaker: JORGE
dialogues.text: My cousin is a busboy. Let me make a telephone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley, in a polyester IHOP uniform, sits in a booth wit Korean family. She is in the middle of a story. The famil looks confused and a little scared.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: So then Marvin the butler said that I had to leave because I was too old. It’s all been really heartbreaking. The Korean Grandmother chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: KOREAN GRANDMA
dialogues.text: Where Silver Dollar Pancake?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Um, I know, right. Excuse me! Can we see the manager. The manager comes over to the table. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Could you see what’s up with these guys pancakes and can you also bring me a chocolate shake? The manager removes his hat and puts on a Donald Trump wi

dialogues.speaker: MANAGER
dialogues.text: You're fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley sits in her car, she looks at a picture of Pooter that is hanging from her rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I know it's embarrassing to get fired after twenty minutes and to live in a beat up Honda Accord, but don't lose faith Pooter. I'll get a great job soon and then a super place for us to live. (starts sobbing) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I pinky promise Pooter....pink prius play pattycake pronto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley walks in, passing the "Help Wanted" sign in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley, wearing a sexy sun dress and a nametag, sits on bed. She attempts to assist an OLD COUPLE as they choose mattress.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I used to live with a man your age and he liked his mattress super, super firm. Like this one . You could put a drink on here and it wouldn’t spill. She climbs on and begins jumping up and down. Every time jumps her skirt lifts up showing her underwear.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Now that’s what I’m talking about. As Shelley continues to jump, the old woman fumes.

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: No one wants to see your lady garden, Missy! The old man protests as his wife grabs him by the ear and drags him out of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Shelley exits the HELP WANTED sign goes back up in the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens a crack revealing Scott Caan. He looks out a downtrodden Shelley on his door step.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CAAN
dialogues.text: Shelley?  26 16.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Hey, Scott! Remember how you said you wanted to steal me away from the Mansion? Well, here I am!

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT CAAN
dialogues.text: Oh, uh, yeah. Actually, I'm here with my girlfriend -- He opens the door a crack wider and we see his girlfriend a six-foot-tall GLAMAZON who looks like she could kick th shit out of both of them. SCOTT CAAN (CONT’D) (continuing) -- so I can't really lend you that book you're looking for. But, thanks for stopping by. He shuts the door in her face.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (to herself) What book? Behind the closed door we hear the girlfriend yelling.

dialogues.speaker: GLAMAZON
dialogues.text: G-ddamnit, Scott. What are you, a frickin' library?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley prepares to sleep in her car, still full of all h belongings. Shelley cries, distraught, as she brushes her teeth. She rinses with Diet Coke. She spits her toothpast out the window, then closes it. A moment later, a KNOCK startles her. She rolls the window back down to find a CO holding out a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Ma'am, you just violated code 753. Unlawful spitting.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: But, I was just brushing my teeth --

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (peering inside) Are you residing in this car, ma'am? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: COP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to have to give you another ticket and ask you to move it. Shelley sighs and goes to start the engine. He stares

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Would you maybe stop giving me tickets if I told you I'm having a really bad week because I used to be a Playboy Bunny but I got kicked out of the Mansion because I'm fifty-nine years old? at her for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Ma'am, step out of the car. I'm going to have to ask you to take a Breathalyzer. She gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: I need you to blow on this. Shelley doesn’t look at the Breathalyzer in his hand she sighs and bends toward his crotch.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Alright...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley sits forlornly in a cell full of PROSTITUTES.

dialogues.speaker: TRASHY PROSTITUTE
dialogues.text: You tried to do what? To a cop?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: But I'm not a prostitute. I was just brushing my teeth...

dialogues.speaker: TRASHY PROSTITUTE
dialogues.text: You call it what you like, baby.  28 29 18.

dialogues.speaker: CHUBBY PROSTITUTE
dialogues.text: Don't worry, sweetie, first-timers only get one night.

dialogues.speaker: TALL PROSTITUTE
dialogues.text: Yeah, you'll be back on the street in no time.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: You know, you should go with a more natural look. All that heavy make- up is just hiding your G-d given beauty.

dialogues.speaker: TALL PROSTITUTE
dialogues.text: (sudden deep voice) I’m a dude.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh. Then you’re good like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley, make-up smeared, walks down the jail steps. At a newsstand, Shelley sees Playboy magazine on display. She looks at it longingly, and as Shelley wipes away a tear, sees a group of happy, shiny BLONDE COLLEGE GIRLS. They l together the way she used to laugh with the Bunnies. Draw if to the mother-ship, she follows them as they walk down street.

dialogues.speaker: TALL BLONDE GIRL
dialogues.text: (continuing) Did you hear about the pool party at Jordan's?

dialogues.speaker: SHORT BLONDE GIRL
dialogues.text: He makes the best margaritas. He uses mangos. Shelley's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls round a corner. Shelley does as well taking her first steps onto --  30 31 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tree-lined street filled with large, stately sorority a fraternity houses. Guys play frisbee. Girls sunbathe on t lawns. Barbecues are underway. Shelley takes this in with wide-eyed wonder.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: It’s just like a bunch of little Mansions! She hurries to catch up with the girls, following them to the Phi Mu house -- the biggest and prettiest of them all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tastefully decorated and filled with happy blondes. Shell enters and looks around, out of place in her skimpy outfi next to the preppier college girls. ASHLEY, 21, the Phi M President walks up, perfect and perky.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Yes. I'd like to live here, please.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: (sweetly) Well...you have to be asked to live here. She looks Shelley up and down.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you go to this school? Shelley looks around.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: This is a school? Where are the desks?

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: (still sweetly) No, this is a sorority house at a school. And you do look like an older sluttier version of the type of girl we would want, but I’m sorry you’re not a student. It was so nice talking to you.  32 20. Ashley turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: But I really--

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: So nice. Ashley exits. Shelley starts to leave, disappointed, when she spots --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of SIXTY-SOMETHING WOMEN, talking amongst themsel

dialogues.speaker: SIGMA KAPPA HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: I love what you've done with the living room. The doilies are exquisite.

dialogues.speaker: PHI MU HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: Thank you. I made them myself. I feel every detail in the house should be a reflection of the girls who live here. Shelley enters, confused.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: If I’m fifty-nine you guys must be two hundred and seventy.

dialogues.speaker: PHI MU HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Nothing, do you guys go to school here too? The women stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: PHI MU HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: (coldly) Not anymore. We're housemothers for the sororities on campus.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: That’s so dope. And you live in the houses with the girls?

dialogues.speaker: SIGMA KAPPA HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: Yes.  21.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: That’s even dopier. What’s a housemother do?

dialogues.speaker: TRI SIG HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: We oversee meal plans, chaperone the social events, make sure the girls stay out of trouble... (rolling her eyes to the others) Which is a full-time job in itself - Shelley gasps.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, my gosh, that’s what I used to do at the mansion. It’s the perfect job for me. Can I be one too? The particularly bitchy PHI MU HOUSEMOTHER, 60, looks her over.

dialogues.speaker: PHI MU HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but this is a sorority not a brothel. We have standards; standards that you clearly do not meet. But it was so nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: What’s a brothel? Someone who makes soup?...

dialogues.speaker: ALL THE HOUSEMOTHERS
dialogues.text: So nice. The Phi-Mu Housemother gets up and leaves as the others follow her. The SIGMA KAPPA HOUSEMOTHER lags behind and t pity on Shelley.

dialogues.speaker: SIGMA KAPPA HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: Try Zeta. Their last housemother was hospitalized for schizophrenia and hallucinations. Shelley perks up.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Awesome!  33 34 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley walks out of Phi Mu, stopping a passing sorority girl.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, can you tell me where Zeta is? The girl points to a house down the street. Shelley turns see -- THE ZETA HOUSE. Peeling paint. Dilapidated porch. Brown lawn. Shelley looks disappointed for a moment, then steels her resolve and marches down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley checks her makeup in a compact mirror, makes sure has nothing in her teeth and walks up to the door and kno As she knocks, the Z in "ZTA" falls off and smashes on he head knocking her to the ground. The door opens and we se Maria, 21, smart-girl type, with a phone in her hand. She sees Shelley laying on the porch and rushes to her side.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Oh my G-D. Are you okay? Shelley lifts her head looking a little more dazed than usual.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. I broke your Z.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: It's not your fault. It falls off every time we open the door. She tosses the pieces of the Z into a bush.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (looking up) At least you still have T and A. Shelley offers a high five. Maria stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Who are you? Shelley pops up off the ground, practically exploding wit enthusiasm.  23.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: My name is Shelley and I'm here to be your housemother!

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Well it’s nice to meet you Shelley but it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, no! Did you hire someone else?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: (helping Shelley up) No. It’s just that we may lose our charter, and if we don’t have a house, we wont be needing a housemother.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Why are they going to take your house away?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Well... because we don’t get enough pledges and everyone thinks we’re losers.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: That’s so sad. Why does everyone else get pledges.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Uh, they have great parties and they’re popular and boys want to date them. Shelley perks up.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I'm an expert at parties and boys! I'm a Bunny! Men write to me from prison! Sometimes in their own blood! Maria frowns.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: A Bunny? Like a centerfold?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (blushing) Bless your heart -- no, just a couple of small pictorials. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Girls of the Midwest, Girls of Starbucks, Girls of Charlie Sheen. (then) But now I'm homeless.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. Good luck. She heads inside and starts to shut the door.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Wait -- I can help you! Maria shuts the door. Shelley sighs and starts back down walkway. She stops and looks at the guys hanging around P Mu and the other sororities. SHELLEY (CONT’D) So they want to be popular and have boys want them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria shuts the door and turns around to find Mona, 21, a heavily pierced feminist with a shaved head. She is readi piece of paper and wearing a T-shirt that says “legalize castration”.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: So if we don't get thirty pledges we lose our charter?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Which also means goodbye zeta. HARMONY, 21, a make-up free hippy chick in a poncho, overhears.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: But I planned on having a drum circle in the backyard for the Summer Solstice.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I need to worry about getting thirty pledges right now, Harmony. Not the three stoners who might show up for your bongo party.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Thirty pledges? But there's only fourteen of us.  36 25.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Fourteen and a half. Harmony points at BECKY, an eight-months PREGNANT GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Actually fourteen and three quarters as of last week.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: They know we're never going to get that many pledges. It's just their way of shutting us down. JOANNE, 21, wearing a large scoliosis brace, walks up, up

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: You guys, this is so awful..

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I know. (noticing) You’ve got some refrigerator magnets on your brace again. Maria pulls the magnets off Joanne’s brace.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: Oh my G-d... Joanne is looking out the front window.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are boys on the lawn. Our lawn. On the front lawn several boys have drifted over to see Shelley, who is doing YOGA IN HER BIKINI. We see even mor guys approaching.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Are they lost?

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley continues with her poses as guys linger. The Zeta girls all come out of the house to investigate. A HOT GUY a lacrosse shirt approaches Shelley.  26.

dialogues.speaker: HOT GUY
dialogues.text: Hey, are you a Zeta? Shelley looks to Maria, then

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I wish.

dialogues.speaker: HOT GUY
dialogues.text: I do too. Cuz Zeta would be my new favorite hizzity hang. Maria steps to the front of the pack of Zetas.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: She’s not a Zeta. She’s our new hizzity housemother. She’1ll be hizzity here all the tizzity time.

dialogues.speaker: HOT GUY
dialogues.text: (horny ) Ooh, that’s tight. All the guys on the lawn nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRLS of Zeta -- a motley crew of 14 various misfits- sit on ratty couches staring at Shelley as she greets everyone with unbridled enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, you guys! I'm so happy you want me here! You won’t be sorry! Hey -- let’s have a pillow fight! Shelley grabs a pillow and hits Tanya ( A 21 year old lit person) who rolls hard from the pillow blow into a wall. Shelley gives a whoopsie look. MONA is appalled.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: This is how we're going to get pledges? By hiring an archaically superficial reflection of the male fantasy? Shelley smiles and waves, pleased by this "compliment".  27.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Exactly -- Guys like her, Mona. And if you haven't noticed, guys don't like us. TANYA getting up off the floor points to the pregnant gir

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: Apparently some guy liked Becky. The girls all laugh. Becky does a goofy dirty dancing mov

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: So, in order to be a sisterhood, now we have to be "popular"?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: No. In order to keep our house we have to be popular. Maybe Shelley can teach us how. The girls start talking among themselves. Shelley raises hand.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Okay, look -- let’s put a pin in the pillow fight, for now. And don’t get me wrong, I love boys. But I lived in a house full of girls for nine years and I know there is nothing more fun than being with your sisters, sharing, talking all night, body painting, and baking penis cookies. The girls stare at her. CARRIE MAE, 21, a heavy big tooth farm girl in jeans and a sleeveless T-shirt, takes the toothpick out of her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: Where in tarnation did you live?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: The Playboy Mansion.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: Jiminy Cricket! The girls react. Lilly a shy English girl whispers in Mar ear.  38 28.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: No, that doesn’t make her a hooker Lilly. Lilly turns bright red and runs out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria leads a bewildered Shelley into a small room behind kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Okay, this is your room. Here's the key. Shelley sets her bags down on the bed and holds the key o her heart.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Thank you so much, Maria. I promise you I'm going to help Zeta Tits and Ass become the best sorority ever!

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Actually, it's Zeta Tau Alpha. They're Greek letters.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh my G-d, I met the King of Greece once at the Mansion! We should invite him to the next party! He's really furry but a super good dancer.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Well if it will help us get pledges invite all the Kings you want. Carrie Mae enters with a tool box.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: Well, ma’am I don’t know about the other girls but I’m glad your here cuz we got some stuff that needs fixing.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Don’t you have a smelly Russian man who comes and fixes things and hugs you a lot?  39 40 29.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: We don’t have a pot to pee in. The smelly Russian man is you. Off of Shelley’s look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley walks out of a stall with the plunger stuck to he bare midriff. There is an expression of bewilderment on h face. She looks to Harmony for help.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Are there instructions for this thing? Harmony rolls her eyes, grabs hold of the plunger and sta pulling. It finally breaks free sending her sprawling. Shelley looks at the round mark on her stomach. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Hey, that thing ate my belly ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley is opening and closing the lid of the garbage can Mona walks in and stares at her in disbelief. Shelley tur to her.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: This isn’t broken.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: (pointing to the sink) The garbage disposal, Bunny. Shelley walks over to the sink and looks in it. She looks Mona.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with it?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: I don’t know, look and see. As Shelley looks in the hole Mona flips the switch and a stream of ground up garbage shoots out covering Shelley's face. Shelley pulls a completely mangled spoon out of her mouth.  4l 42 30.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I found the problem.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You are so vapid.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: You’re like the hundredth person who's told me that. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a TOPLESS Shelley from behind, walking out of the bathroom, freshly showered. Towel around her head and tow around her waist. As she walks down the hall we see the Zeta’s diving back in their rooms in shock and embarrassm Lilly the shy English girl actually faints. Maria rounds corner, reading a letter.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Afternoon, Maria! Maria looks up and reels back at Shelley's toplessness.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Shelly! Where's your robe?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, I just like to air dry.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I don’t think half the girls here have seen their own bodies naked they certainly want to see your perfectly engineered boobs. Maria takes off her jacket and puts it over her.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I’m just walking around in the body g-d and Dr. Silver gave me.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Come with me. We have work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley, now dressed, sits down on Maria's bed, all busin Maria holds up the letter.  31.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: We have twenty-eight days before national headquarters shows up with a For Sale sign.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: You need 30 pledges? How many did you get last year?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: One. But she got transgender surgery and moved to the boys' dorm. Technically, Bob is still a Zeta but she’s not allowed to live here with a weiner. She points to the Zeta composite picture where we see BOB the bottom corner -- a hulking, angry-looking, extremely masculine girl.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Well, this year, we're going to get lots and lots of pledges! The kind that don't want testicles. Their own, I mean. Shelly laughs really hard at this cute joke. Maria waves letter she was reading.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: We also need to raise money for our philanthropy. We're the only chapter that didn't meet the fund- raising requirement.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: What's a philacanopee?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Philanthropy. It's like a charity.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I love doing charity. One time at the mansion I even let Gary Coleman grind on me during a slow dance.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Look, rush starts in three weeks. Here's some ideas I came up with that might make us popular. She hands Shelley a list.  32.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (reading) "Host a 'CSI' night. Start a bee- keeping club. Have a Googlefest. B.Y.O.M. Bring your own man?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Bring your own mouse. Shelley tries to be excited, but is in fact, quite worrie

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, wow -- these are super, super good ideas. But we might want to do something a little more -- sexy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All fourteen Zetas stand outside in baggy T-shirts and sweatpants -- staring in absolute horror.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Is she serious?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: I am so offended right now. The object of their scorn is -- Shelley, standing next to sign that says “Zeta Car Wash” in skimpy bikini bottoms a tank top, hose in hand, sexily sudsing up her own car.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: C'mon girls, washing cars is a fun and sexy way to raise money. She undulates with the hose as the girls look on, horrifi Maria implores them.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Just give it a chance --

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: (re her brace) I can't bend that way. Plus if my brace gets wet it could rust. The girls laugh. So does Joanne.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: See? We’re already having fun.  33. Shelley waves to some passing BOYS.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Hi, boys! One of them is COLBY, 21, smokin' hot. Maria eyes him wit terrified lust.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: (sotto) Oh, my G-d! That's Colby! I love him! What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Do sexy! As the boys near, Shelley milks it even more, putting on act for their benefit. SHELLEY (CONT’D) (continuing) Wash those cars, you sexy bitches!

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Did she just call us bitches?

dialogues.speaker: TONYA
dialogues.text: Did she just call us sexy? A few of the girls are trying halfheartedly to get involv Becky has waddled over to the bucket but can’t bend over pregnant belly to get a sponge out. Carrie Mae keeps spit her chewing tobacco on the car window and scrubs aggressi at a birdshit stain.. It is not having the effect that Shelley wanted so she turns the hose on herself, dousing chest with water.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Uh oh, look -- wet T-shirt. The guys get psyched. Maria picks up a hose and tries to emulate her.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: And wet pants! Maria squirts herself in the crotch, but alas, she does n look sexy. She looks like she's peed herself.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oopsie. Someone went accident in her sexy pants.  34. Colby averts his gaze and turns back to Shelley.

dialogues.speaker: COLBY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Anyway, we're having some drinks over at Theta Chi later. Wanna come over?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Well, we are a little thirsty... She drinks suggestively from the hose, then holds it out Colby. SHELLEY (CONT’D) (continuing) Wanna sip?

dialogues.speaker: COLBY
dialogues.text: Sure. He bends closer to take a sip as -- NEARBY, Mona cranks u the faucet so Colby is BLASTED in the face with water. He jumps back, now soaked, as Mona cracks up. Maria rushes toward him with a towel.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Are you okay? He takes the towel and gives Mona a dirty look. Mona hits back with a ‘bring it on look.’ Shelley tries to save the day.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: So, what time should we come over for drinks?

dialogues.speaker: COLBY
dialogues.text: Now that I think about it, the guest list is pretty full. Maybe next time. The guys walk off as Maria watches in despair.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: (to the Zetas) I think we're done here “sexy bitches”. They all go back in the house.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: (to Shelley) I better go talk to them --  35. She follows, dejected. Shelley is left alone. Then, she’s sees a good looking guy stapling a flier to a telephone p It’s OLIVER, 30’s, shy and cute. As he walks over to his Shelley calls out to him.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Hi. Do you need a car wash? Oliver looks around to confirm Shelley is talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Me? Oh, uh no, I gotta get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh. I’m at work right now.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: You wash cars?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: No, I’m the Zeta sorority Housemother. Oliver approaches Shelley.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Really? You seem too young to be a Housemother.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (excited) Really? You think I’m young?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: How sweet. What’s your job?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I manage a nursing home.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s so great you give nurses a place to live.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Actually it’s a home for senior citizens. You know, old people.  44 36.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I know lots of old men. Hairy and not hairy.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Well, I have to get going. Oliver hands her one of the fliers he was putting up.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you ever want to stop by the nursing home we always need volunteers to help out and visit with the seniors.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (looks at flier) Thanks. I’m Shelley. I like long walks and I hate rude people.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (laughing) Cool. I’m Oliver. They shake hands warmly, then Oliver goes to his car and drives off. Shelley looks at his flier, her face lights u as she gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria is in the midst of an argument with the other girls Shelley enters from the yard, still in her bikini.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (continuing) You guys, I just had the best idea for our philanthropy. We’re going to volunteer at Oliver’s nursing home.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Who’s Oliver?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: They guy I just met.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: You see? Shelley knows how to meet guys, and if guys are hanging out with us, more girls will want to, hence, more pledges.  A moment, The girls She MEOWS. 37. then...

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Volunteering at a nursing home seems like a nice thing to do. murmur in agreement, except...

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Those places smell funny. Like boiled chicken and pee.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Too bad, we're doing it.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: That’s so great! lLet’s get all dressed up and go to a nightclub and have fruity drinks and dirty dance with each other!

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: We need to bond! We’re sisters! At the Mansion we bonded all the time and everyone loved us and we had lots of friends. And once, a psychic came over and told me that my cat Pooter and I were cousins in a past life which totally makes sense because I can do this -- The girls stare at her.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: Why did you tell us that?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just like that story.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I think what Shelley is trying to say is that we should go out and have some fun. Pledges like fun.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I like fun...

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: Me, too.  38.

dialogues.speaker: TONYA
dialogues.text: (trying to do shelly) Meow.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: It is five dollar pitcher night at the Think Tank... Shelley puts her arm around Becky.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Come on, who’s with us?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I’ve been boycotting that place but I can’t remember why so I guess we could go. Mona rolls her eyes and holds up a textbook.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: I have more important things to do.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I think it’s the perfect place for you to find a thesis topic for your gender relations class.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: (thinks for a beat) Okay. But that’s the only reason I’m going.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: (reading a text from her phone) Lilly says to have fun but she has to stay and clean the closet. A closet door opens a crack and a hand waves goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot drunken college kids eye each other, trying to figure who they're going to shag. Bad KARAOKE is going on in the corner as some frat guys sing Guns n' Roses. The Zetas lo bit uncomfortable. A bartender pours them a round of kami shots. Shelley takes one and holds hers up.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: To Zeta! Here's to making you the best sorority ever!  39. They all do a shot( Becky goes to but Maria grabs it from her). Shelley spots a guy staring at Mona's facial hardwa in horrified fascination. SHELLEY (CONT’D) (continuing) Mona, that guy's checking you out. Flirt with him! Mona looks over and sidles up to the guy nervously.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: GUY AT BAR
dialogues.text: I’m going fishing tomorrow. Can I borrow some of your face lures. Mona bites him as he screams and runs away. Shelley point out another guy to Carrie Mae.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Ooh, there's a big box of cutesicles -- Carrie Mae checks him out, then walks over, leaning back the bar in what she thinks is a seductive pose.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: Excuse me. You know where the shitter is? I gotta take a horse dump like you wouldn't believe. The guy bolts. Repulsed. Carrie Mae calls out to him.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s not like I farted! Shelley frowns.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: We might need to work on your talking to people skills. Ashley, the Phi Mu President, and COURTNEY, another Phi M both perfectly primped, walk past noticing our girls.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: (friendly) Oh, hey, Zetas! Hi! We never see you guys out.  40. The Zetas smile, happy to be acknowledged by the popular girls.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Hi! I met you yesterday. I was the homeless girl.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Oh right...

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Now I'm their housemom!

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Congratulations. (to Maria) Maria, right? I remember you from the last Panhellenic meeting. You were the one who wanted to add an economics day to Greek Week.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Oh, my gosh -- we could have a costume party where people come dressed as their favorite economist and anyone who brings a copy of Capitalism and Freedom can get in free. Get it? Cuz it’s a book about free markets.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.... hey, by the way, you guys got here just in time. We're having a karaoke contest. Sororities versus fraternities. She points to the stage where some Kappa Sigs finish thei butchery of "PARADISE CITY".

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: You guys could go next if you want... The Zetas look at each other, reluctant.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: We'll pick a good song for you. Don't worry, you can't be any worse than we were.  41.

dialogues.speaker: COURTNEY
dialogues.text: Seriously -- we were wretched. They gesture for the Zetas to follow them to the stage. T Zetas hang back.

dialogues.speaker: MONA, (CONT'D)

Those losers were inches away from losing their house and now they look like the queens of the campus. Ashley is so upset now she whips an M&M at Courtney’s oth tit. SHELLEY (CONT’D) But I don’t want to bore you with all that girly stuff. So let’s talk about something else. She smiles. Oliver is not what you would call a player so is a little awkward around Shelley’s none too hidden sexuality.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Um, Okay. Who are you gonna vote for?  67.

dialogues.text: Umm, I’1l ask. Oliver looks at her puzzled then orders.

dialogues.text: Yeah, me neither. Isn’t that weird? Shelley thinks she's losing him so she tries her "in dema tactic. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Well, I hope they don’t take too long with our food, because I have another date at ten.

dialogues.text: The Zetas are hanging with some cute boys. Mona is playin beer pong against a fraternity guy and winning. She sinks another one. The guy drinks it and then starts swaying.

SHELLEY (CONT’D) Come on Joanne, say something to him. Spread your wings, butterfly. Joanne goes to say something but she can’t. SHELLEY (CONT’D) He’s getting away! You can do this! You know why? (MORE )

dialogues.text: A mole? It looks more like a pUppy-

dialogues.text: The girls are all gathered in the living room for Bid Nig

dialogues.text: Are you guys sure?
