dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Well, we’ve sort of achieved an image here, and to be honest I don’t know if this girl fits in. She seemed kind of weird. She was eating our cake with her fingers.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: I saw her watching Iron Chef during the party.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: You see? Kind of socially awkward and brunette.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, dump her. Forget it. The phone in the kitchen rings. Someone comes back and sa it’s for Shelley. Shelley exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: HEF
dialogues.text: Is this my darling Shelley?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Hef?

dialogues.speaker: HEF
dialogues.text: Oh thank heavens. I’m so glad we found you.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I can’t believe I’m hearing your voice. I’ve totally missed you and I’m so sorry for whatever I did.

dialogues.speaker: HEF
dialogues.text: What you did?  83.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Marvin gave me the birthday card you wrote...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next slide is a meeker girl with thick glasses.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Katootoo Jihiman. Sociology. From India. Everyone?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Could those glasses be any thicker?

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: Yeah, and hair conditioner called, it wants to know why you won’t use it.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: Not up to Zeta standards.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: No way. Nah. Next. Lilly peaks her head out of her door. Next slide. A little person. Looks good other than that.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Jodi Taylor. Film school. New Mexico. Everyone?

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: (noticing Tonya) She’s okay. I guess. Yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: TONYA
dialogues.text: Hey, don’t look at me. I thought she was weird. All she talked about was Justin Timberlake and her pet lizard.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: (relieved) Phewwww, thanks. We agree....

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Look at you people! Is this really what you have become? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Judging other girls on their appearance, calling them ‘weird’? I’m sure glad I joined when I did because I probably wouldn’t make the cut these days. And neither would a lot of you. I can’t believe that Zeta has become just like Phi Mu. A bunch of snooty bitches! Lilly gets so self conscience that she finally spoke that bolts toward the window and dives out. Everyone stares at each other. She was right about what she said. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley on phone, much happier.

dialogues.speaker: HEF
dialogues.text: It was bad information you received, Shelly, and to prove it to you darling, I want you to be the March centerfold. Shelley’s eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh my g-d! Hef, that is so awesome. I can’t believe it!.

dialogues.speaker: HEF
dialogues.text: Believe it. And I want you to move back to the Mansion. It’s just not the same without you. Shelley's smile is gigantic but she notices things around kitchen that remind her of her new family, a Zeta calenda the wall, pictures from the Aztec party and the nursing h with Oliver in front are on the fridge. Hef keeps talking but we don’t hear what he is saying anymore. Shelley is having second thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry Hef. I love you, but I can’t do it. I just can’t. I’ve started a new family and I’m gonna stay here with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls are still sitting in silence.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Oh my G-D. What have we become?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: It all started with this fake blonde hair. And these stupid water bras. We’re just a bunch of clones. Completely interchangeable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley hangs up the phone and starts back to the living room. Just as she reaches the door she hears Mona talking and stops. INT. ZETA LIVING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS 101

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: This is all Shelley's fault. Before she got here we were individuals she’s turned us into stupid bunnies. We’d be so much better off if she had never came into our lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley. Shocked. Hurt. A tear. She quickly runs back to her room unnoticed. INT. ZETA LIVING ROOM —- CONTINUOUS 103

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: You’re right about us. But you are wrong about Shelley. She is the best thing that ever happened to this place. She didn’t just change our outward appearance. She changed our attitudes. We can throw parties now. Heck, I may even have a boyfriend for the first time in my life. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MARIA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Mona, you no longer have a that stupid bone going through your nose. Everyone agrees that is a good one. Lilly coming back in house.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: And she got me to talk. Everyone agrees, happily.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: And she freed me from my fears. More agreement.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You’re right. I just think we need to tone it down a little. Be more of who we were.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: It will be the perfect mix. Half Shelley. Half us.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: Where is Shelley, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: In the kitchen. Hey Shelley! She doesn’t answer. They all go to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley sits in her car. Crying. Writing a letter. She looks at the picture of Pooter hanging from her rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I can’t be myself with Oliver, and I tried to turn the girls into something they don’t want to be. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well Pooter, I guess all I am is just a dumb bunny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley's car pulls up. She gets out and approaches the f door. She takes out an envelope, we see the name ‘Oliver’ it. She drops it through the mail slot and heads back to car and drives off. INT. SHELLEY’S CAR 107 Shelley drives the windy Sunset Boulevard. Her cellphone rings, she answers.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Shelley, it’s Maria. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I’m moving back to the mansion. Hef called last night and said he wanted me to be the March centerfold.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: (trying to be happy) Oh, wow. Congratulations. That’s awesome.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s what I always wanted. So....

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: So good. Good. Great. All your dreams are finally coming true.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess they are. You guys have a great rush, I’m sure you’ll get a million new pledges. Tell everyone I said goodbye. Shelley hangs up. Maria is confused, something doesn’t se right...  108 109 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC plays as a MONTAGE BEGINS. Joanne, Mona and Becky o again have their heads in the sinks as stylists attend to them. Harmony, Tanya and Carrie Mae are under the dryer.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: Well, whatever we're gonna be, we need to figure it out. We still need 30 girls by Oct. 15th, or we can kiss it all goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: When we show these girls who we really are I don’t think we’1ll have any problems. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley pulls in to a hero’s welcome. She is almost enjoy it. We see Cassandra walking down the driveway with Marvi carrying her luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver opens a letter. Its the one Shelley was writing. W hear his voice reading it over the rest of the montage.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I am sorry I couldn’t tell you this in person. It was way too embarrassing to face you after all we've been through. I’m leaving the Zeta house to fulfill my life long dream. And I know that it won’t make any sense to you. I’m going to work in the Peace Corps in the mountains of Peru.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joanne and Carrie Mae, now brunette again, stand alongsid Mona who is still blonde, but with a more punk rock haird and a defiant stripe of blue. They hand out ZETA LOLLIPOP while Harmony strums her guitar.  112 113 114 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat jumps into Shelley’s arms. Shelley smiles and hol the cat up to her face for a kiss. Then with an even bigg smile on her face, walks over and places the cat inside t dog fence. The dogs start chasing her all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harmony, now make-up free, pokes holes in her water bra w a steak knife and waters the rosebushes. Behind her, Mari and Joanne hang a Rush banner that reads: "ZETA: BE WHO Y WANNA BE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver finishes the letter. Looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley is ready for bed, talking to Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: .--. and that’s when I overheard the girls talking about me. I thought they’d be better off without me so... here I am.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I don’t know Shelley, it sounds like they were better off with you.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I guess not. And you know what really sucks is for the first time in my life, I really felt like people liked me for what I had to say. I was even going to sign up for some night classes next semester so I could come up with even smarter things to say to people but I guess that would be stupid now. This hits Marvin.  90. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Anyway, good night Marvin. It’s great to talk to you again.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: It sure is Shelly. Good night. Marvin goes to exit, pausing at the door for a moment to at Shelley rolling over sadly to go to sleep. Then he exi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria is holding court. The other Zetas are talking to rushees on the lawn. They all have a confidence and enthusiasm that wasn’t there before.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Zeta was founded on the tenets of sisterhood, friendship and philanthropy. Since then we’ve added kick ass parties to the list. Joanne is talking to some girls by the front steps.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: There really isn’t a Zeta type. We’re open to all girls who are looking for something different. That’s why our rush theme is “Be who you want to be”.

dialogues.speaker: EAGER RUSHEE
dialogues.text: Zeta's still totally my first choice.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER RUSHEE
dialogues.text: Me, too. Maria smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly walks across the quad. She has all the pledge bids her hands. There must be about 100 of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly walks up to the counter. The clerk is on the phone, shuffling through some papers. There is a cute guy standi there who notices her.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: TYLER
dialogues.text: Hi. Are you new on campus? I don’t think we’ve ever met. My name is Cole. Lilly puts the invites down on the counter and fixes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: I just...transferred. My name is Lilly. Ashley walks in to drop off her bids. She sees Lilly is i deep conversation. She sees Lilly’s envelopes. While the clerk is still turned around, she acts quickly and slides them into the nearby garbage can. The clerk finishes his phone call. Ashley hands her invites to him.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: She just dropped these on the floor. Can you send them out for her?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Sure thing. Ashley exits. Lilly turns around. Notices the invites are missing. Starts to freak.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: What happened to all those invites??

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: I got ‘em. Don’t worry.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Pheww. You scared me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley is looking at old party photos on the wall. She i about to be part of history. She pauses at one for a beat longer than the rest.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) Nah. No way. The Playboy EDITOR appears behind her. He pulls out a cha for her.  92.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: (continuing) So let's get started on your centerfold interview. Shelley sits. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s start with ambitions.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Well my ambition was to be a centerfold.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: So all your dreams have come true. Shelley nods, halfheartedly.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Yeah...I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: Guilty pleasure?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Eating cookie dough with my best friend Maria... who secretly hates me. He takes notes.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: We'll just change "who hates me" to "in the nude". He makes a note on his papers.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, hit me with your turn-ons.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (wistful) Someone who's kind and sweet to old people. A bad dancer. And guys whose first name begins with 0.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Wow. That's hot. Turn offs? Shelley thinks for a moment.  120 121 93.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Cauliflower, global warming, and misogyny.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR
dialogues.text: Let's just change "misogyny" to “mean people”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s all decked out. Furniture moved to the sides of the room. They are ready for the 100 girls to show up. Our girls look really nice, and are just waiting around. Mona walks in with a huge bowl.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: This should be big enough to hold everyone’s name.

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: I bet we're the first sorority to pick their pledges by drawing names out of a bowl.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: This way we don’t have to judge people. The first 30 girls picked get the bids.

dialogues.speaker: JOANNE
dialogues.text: All the girls are so nice. Maybe I’1l move out so we can pick 31.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: I could move out or we might only be able to pick 29.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: If there is a shy pledge, she can have my closet. Mona is looking out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Hey check this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the rushees are piling into the other houses. No one coming to Zeta.  122 94. Ashley and Courtney welcome their huge throng.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: HARMONY
dialogues.text: Do you think everyone changed their minds?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You did send out the invitations, didn’t you Lilly?

dialogues.speaker: LILLY
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: LILLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guys...Ashley must have stolen them. She was there when I was there. And there was this boy there. And I never talked to one before. And I got his phone number. And, and, and...

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: That bitch. Time for her to get cut. Mona opens her switchblade. Everyone is ready to kill.  123 124 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls burst out of the house and head for Phi Mu. Mon is the first one there, getting in Ashley's face.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You couldn’t beat us so you had to pull this crap.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: What? There is general hub bub and name calling amongst the two sororities finally the Phi Mu housemother steps in.

dialogues.speaker: PHI MU HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: Girls. Girls. Girls. Where is your spirit of sisterhood? This should be a great day. Inviting others to join us as sisters for life.

dialogues.speaker: CARRIE MAE
dialogues.text: (pointing to Ashley) She stole our bids.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: I don’t have any idea what you are talking about.

dialogues.speaker: PHI MU HOUSEMOTHER
dialogues.text: Now, we had a deal. And it appears that you have not fulfilled it. So Monday Zeta will appear in front of the Pan-Hellenic council to have their charter revoked. If you have any evidence of your charges against Ashley you can present it there. The Zetas look devastated as they head back to their hous The Phi-Mus wave goodbye and fake like they are wiping aw tears as they head back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelley is getting ready to shoot her centerfold. She has chosen the library as her setting. She is posing next to of the bookshelves with a cart full of books. She is not nude but she is very skimpily dressed. There is a person a fog machine and a person with a wind machine. Everyone bustling around. Shelley looks distracted.  96.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: We need more fog! The guy cranks up the machine a little and a cloud of smo envelopes Shelley.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (coughing) Why would there be fog in a library?

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: It’s sexy. Who knows maybe someone is smoking. Maria enters.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Or maybe it’s because your butt is smoking hot.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (excited for the first time) Maria! What are you doing here? They run to each other and hug. While Maria and Shelley a talking, various hair, make-up people and clothing stylis work on Shelley like a Nascar pit crew. Going as far as flossing her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: I came to straighten out the mix up about what you overheard the girls saying about you.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: How do you know about that?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Well, let’s just say a little bird told me. Maria looks to the door, Marvin is standing there smiling Maria looks back to Shelley.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: What bird? Maria and Marvin react, Marvin walks over and stands righ next to Maria.  125 97.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Shelley, Marvin called me and said you told him everything that happened. It was alla misunderstanding so I came right over.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: But I heard what you guys said about. Everyone thinks I ruined Zeta. Mona said I turned you all into a bunch of dumb bunnies. OUCH! One of the pit crew has plucked an unwanted hair from Shelley’s butt with a pair of tweezers and holds it up proudly. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Could I have five minutes guys. Everyone walks away as Shelley puts on a robe and leads M to a different room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls enter the room which is adorned with old photos the wall.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Mona was just talking about our hair and the way we were dressing. Maybe we did go a little to far. But everybody loves you. For the next ten minutes we all talked about how you were the best thing that ever happened to us. The house just isn’t the same without you. Shelley’s eyes well up a bit at this news.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Of course. You’re the best housemother any sorority has ever seen. They hug.  126 98.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Oh my G-d, I have to thank Marvin. And where’s that big bird, I’d like to thank it, too.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Shelley, forget about the -- I will pass on your thanks to the bird.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (breaking the hug) So what happened with rush?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Well, we had tons of girls interested, but no one showed up because Ashley stole our bids. We have no proof but she did.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: So the house is gone?

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. We’re supposed to go in front of the Pan-Hellenic council on Monday to make it official but I don’t think any of us are even going to show up. We been humiliated enough in our lives. Shelley looks at the old PHOTOS on the wall of Hef and hi exploits throughout the years. She stops in front of the she was staring at before and pulls it off the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Maybe someone else does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large auditorium style classroom. It is filled with sorority and fraternity types. There is a table at the fr with Ashley and a couple of other “Greek” leaders. There also a large screen and a projection system. Mrs. Hagstro and Mr. Walker, her fraternity counterpart, are obviously running things.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WALKER
dialogues.text: So the new goal for fund-raising next semester is two thousand dollars per house. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MR. WALKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyone coming in above that will be honored in our yearly banquet. All those in favor say aye.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: Aye. On the big screen the group shot from the Zeta’s appears.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HAGSTROM
dialogues.text: Now, our last order of business. Unfortunately, not all of us will be here next year. Shelley and all the girls enter at the back of the auditorium. MRS. HAGSTROM (CONT’D) For the fifth year in a row the Zeta’s did not fulfill their rush requirements so they will be de- certified and their house put up for sale. All those in favor say..... Shelley makes her way down the center aisle. Everyone hub bubs.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Not so fast. I have one piece of business that I think everyone will want to see, before you get to your piece.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HAGSTROM
dialogues.text: Please Miss Darlington, you are not a housemother anymore. You don’t even have a house. This fine institution of higher learning will be much better off without a band of misfits led by a wanna be porn star. This institution is and always will be hose bag free.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I couldn’t have said it better myself. The crowd...huh, what? Carrie Mae gets the guy running th projector in a headlock and Mona drops in the slide. It i picture of Hef from Woodstock. He is standing next to a v muddy, very naked, very hairy hippy. On closer examinatio see that it is a young Mrs. Hagstrom and she is grabbing Hef’s crotch. The crowd bursts into heated conversation.  100. SHELLEY (CONT’D) Are these the type of values we would like to promote Mrs. Hagstrom?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HAGSTROM
dialogues.text: That is not me!

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Then I guess there must be two people who have a freaky mole on their neck that looks like a puppy. Mona drops another slide in and we see that it is a close of the mole on the hippy’s neck. Mrs. Hagstrom covers her neck and starts to stutter.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. HAGSTROM
dialogues.text: But... I mean... It was The Sixties. (she goes for the projector) You can’t blame me I was shrooming. The hubbubs go crazy. Mr. Walker bangs a gavel on the tab to get everyone to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WALKER
dialogues.text: While this is without a doubt the most interesting meeting I’ve been to in a while, I think it is time to resolve these issues and move on. So here is how it is going to work. We’re all going to start over. Mrs. Hagstrom, you’re gonna tone it down and act like a human being again from now on with or without the assistance of mushrooms. Mrs. Hagstrom nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WALKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As for the girls of Phi-Mu, I wish I could put you on probation for being mean and nasty people but I can’t so I will just tell you, try to be less bitchy. The girls are shocked.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WALKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You heard me.  127 101. He turns to the Zeta’s.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WALKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that brings us to the Zeta’s, you’re going to keep your house, your dignity, and your self esteem, but maybe you could shave your legs every once in a while? The Zeta’s nod in agreement then celebrate, all gathering around Shelley and hugging her.

dialogues.speaker: MR. WALKER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But next year you will get enough pledges and meet all the other requirements or we will be back here.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Yes sir! Ashley walks over and angrily whispers to Mrs. Hagstrom.

dialogues.speaker: ASHLEY
dialogues.text: And you yelled at me for wearing open toed shoes! The Beer Pong Dude stands up.

dialogues.speaker: BEER PONG DUDE
dialogues.text: Can we get a copy of that picture?

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: It’s all yours. Mona flings it out into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: BEER PONG DUDE
dialogues.text: Great. I’m gonna post it on www.need-a-trim.com. Everyone laughs except Mrs. Hagstrom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls all enter the house. Everyone is celebrating th victory.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: That was awesome Shelley. You saved us again.  128 102.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Hef and Marvin get a lot of the credit, too.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: This is so great. Everything worked out perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Well, not perfectly. Real perfection would be me and Oliver together right now. But that can never be cause I moved to Peru and only left him a note.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: But you didn’t really move to Peru.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I know that but he doesn’t. Shelley walks towards the kitchen a little dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Shelley enters she sees Oliver standing under a banner that says “Welcome Back from Peru Shelley”. He is holding bouquet of flowers. Shelley shyly walks over to him. All girls enter now.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: How did you know I was back from Peru?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: A little bird told me.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: I got to meet this freakin bird and take him to dinner or something.

dialogues.speaker: MARIA
dialogues.text: Me. I’m the bird. I called Oliver up the minute I found out you were upset. Shelley is touched. She puts her hands over her heart.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: (to Maria) This is what it must feel like to have a best friend. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Oliver) Now I have to admit something to you. I didn’t go to Peru.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Get out of here. Everyone in the room laughs.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Also, I was in Playboy.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: I know, Shelly. And I have something to admit to you. I was totally wrong about saying girls in Playboy are bimbos. Because you are the sweetest, funniest, most caring and generous girl I’ve ever met in my life, not to mention your incredible brain and medium boobs.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: So... you’ll be my boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: Heck yeah. I mean how many guys who manage a nursing home get to say they have a Playmate Centerfold for a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Actually I left before we did the photo shoot. But if you have a camera I can be your personal private centerfold.

dialogues.speaker: OLIVER
dialogues.text: (yelling) Does anyone have a camera I can borrow right now?!! I’1l give you everything I own!!!!!!!! Shelley laughs as Oliver pulls her in for a kiss. We see the girls peeking in at the kitchen door. Everyone oooohh and ahhhs. We hear a knock on the back door. The girls wa into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Shelley, it’s for you. Marvin enters the room, still shirtless, carrying a suitc  104.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Marvin, what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: I’ve been hired as the Zeta House’s new butler. Since you'll be taking classes next semester, you'll need someone to help out around here. Oh, and Hef wanted me to let you know that the Zetas have a lifetime pass into the mansion. The girls all react, psyched.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Marvin, I guess all I can say is... welcome to my new family!

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Ladies. I am at your disposal.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY
dialogues.text: Disposal. Right. I think the garbage disposal is broken. After you fix that we’ll take some mangoritas on the front porch.

dialogues.speaker: MARVIN
dialogues.text: Not a problem. All the girls come in for a group hug as we fade.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC AND CREDITS
dialogues.text: UNDER CREDITS we see a rockin’ ZETA HOUSEPARTY including

dialogues.speaker: SHELLEY, OLIVER AND ALL THE RESIDENTS OF THE NURSING HOME
dialogues.text: partying with the Zetas and other students.
